trans-unit.source: IPython Notebook | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: IPython Notebook | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that shows how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that shows how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: IPython Notebook on Azure
trans-unit.target: IPython Notebook on Azure

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>IPython project</linkText><title></title></link> provides a collection of tools for scientific computing that include powerful interactive shells, high-performance and easy to use parallel libraries and a web-based environment called the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>IPython project</linkText><title></title></link> provides a collection of tools for scientific computing that include powerful interactive shells, high-performance and easy to use parallel libraries and a web-based environment called the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: The Notebook provides a working environment for interactive computing that combines code execution with the creation of a live computational document.
trans-unit.target: The Notebook provides a working environment for interactive computing that combines code execution with the creation of a live computational document.

trans-unit.source: These notebook files can contain arbitrary text, mathematical formulas, input code, results, graphics, videos and any other kind of media that a modern web browser is capable of displaying.
trans-unit.target: These notebook files can contain arbitrary text, mathematical formulas, input code, results, graphics, videos and any other kind of media that a modern web browser is capable of displaying.

trans-unit.source: Whether you're absolutely new to Python and want to learn it in a fun, interactive environment or do some serious parallel/technical computing, the IPython Notebook is a great choice.
trans-unit.target: Whether you're absolutely new to Python and want to learn it in a fun, interactive environment or do some serious parallel/technical computing, the IPython Notebook is a great choice.

trans-unit.source: As an illustration of its capabilities, the
trans-unit.target: As an illustration of its capabilities, the

trans-unit.source: following screenshot shows the IPython Notebook being used, in combination with the SciPy and Matplotlib packages, to analyze the structure of a sound recording.
trans-unit.target: following screenshot shows the IPython Notebook being used, in combination with the SciPy and Matplotlib packages, to analyze the structure of a sound recording.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This article will show you how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Microsoft
trans-unit.target: This article will show you how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: By using the IPython
trans-unit.target: By using the IPython

trans-unit.source: Notebook on Azure, you can easily provide a web-accessible interface to
trans-unit.target: Notebook on Azure, you can easily provide a web-accessible interface to

trans-unit.source: scalable computational resources with all the power of Python and its many
trans-unit.target: scalable computational resources with all the power of Python and its many

trans-unit.source: libraries.
trans-unit.target: libraries.

trans-unit.source: Since all installation is done in the cloud, users can access these
trans-unit.target: Since all installation is done in the cloud, users can access these

trans-unit.source: resources without the need for any local configuration beyond a modern web
trans-unit.target: resources without the need for any local configuration beyond a modern web

trans-unit.source: browser.
trans-unit.target: browser.

trans-unit.source: Create and configure a VM on Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and configure a VM on Azure

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a virtual machine (VM) running on Azure.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a virtual machine (VM) running on Azure.

trans-unit.source: This VM is a complete operating system in the cloud and will be used to
trans-unit.target: This VM is a complete operating system in the cloud and will be used to

trans-unit.source: run the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: run the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: Azure is capable of running both Linux and Windows
trans-unit.target: Azure is capable of running both Linux and Windows

trans-unit.source: virtual machines, and we will cover the setup of IPython on both types of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: virtual machines, and we will cover the setup of IPython on both types of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Linux VM
trans-unit.target: Linux VM

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-linux] to create a virtual machine of the OpenSUSE or Ubuntu distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-linux] to create a virtual machine of the OpenSUSE or Ubuntu distribution.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses OpenSUSE 13.2 and Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses OpenSUSE 13.2 and Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.

trans-unit.source: We'll assume the default user name azureuser.
trans-unit.target: We'll assume the default user name azureuser.

trans-unit.source: Windows VM
trans-unit.target: Windows VM

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-windows] to create a virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-windows] to create a virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we'll assume that the user name is azureuser.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we'll assume that the user name is azureuser.

trans-unit.source: Create an endpoint for the IPython Notebook
trans-unit.target: Create an endpoint for the IPython Notebook

trans-unit.source: This step applies to both the Linux and Windows VM.
trans-unit.target: This step applies to both the Linux and Windows VM.

trans-unit.source: Later on we will configure
trans-unit.target: Later on we will configure

trans-unit.source: IPython to run its notebook server on port 9999.
trans-unit.target: IPython to run its notebook server on port 9999.

trans-unit.source: To make this port publicly
trans-unit.target: To make this port publicly

trans-unit.source: available, we must create an endpoint in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: available, we must create an endpoint in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This
trans-unit.target: This

trans-unit.source: endpoint opens up a port in the Azure firewall and maps the public port (HTTPS,
trans-unit.target: endpoint opens up a port in the Azure firewall and maps the public port (HTTPS,

trans-unit.source: 443) to the private port on the VM (9999).
trans-unit.target: 443) to the private port on the VM (9999).

trans-unit.source: To create an endpoint, go to the VM dashboard, click Endpoints, then click **Add
trans-unit.target: To create an endpoint, go to the VM dashboard, click Endpoints, then click **Add

trans-unit.source: Endpoint** and create a new endpoint (called ipython_nb in this example).
trans-unit.target: Endpoint** and create a new endpoint (called ipython_nb in this example).

trans-unit.source: Pick
trans-unit.target: Pick

trans-unit.source: TCP for the protocol, 443 for the public port and 9999 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: TCP for the protocol, 443 for the public port and 9999 for the private port.

trans-unit.target: To run the IPython Notebook on our VM, we must first install IPython and

trans-unit.target: Linux (OpenSUSE)

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM, complete
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM, complete

trans-unit.source: the following steps.
trans-unit.target: the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Install <link><linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title></link> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Linux (Ubuntu)
trans-unit.target: Linux (Ubuntu)

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM and carry out
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM and carry out

trans-unit.source: the following steps.
trans-unit.target: the following steps.

trans-unit.source: First, retrieve new lists of packages with the following command.
trans-unit.target: First, retrieve new lists of packages with the following command.

trans-unit.source: Install <link><linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title></link> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Install <link><linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title></link> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Windows
trans-unit.target: Windows

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies on the Windows VM, use Remote Desktop to connect to the VM.
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies on the Windows VM, use Remote Desktop to connect to the VM.

trans-unit.source: Then carry out the following steps,
trans-unit.target: Then carry out the following steps,

trans-unit.source: using the Windows PowerShell to run all command-line actions.
trans-unit.target: using the Windows PowerShell to run all command-line actions.

trans-unit.source: Note: To download anything using Internet Explorer, you'll need to change some security settings.
trans-unit.target: Note: To download anything using Internet Explorer, you'll need to change some security settings.

trans-unit.source: From Server Manager, click Local Server, then on IE Enhanced Security Configuration, turn it off for administrators.
trans-unit.target: From Server Manager, click Local Server, then on IE Enhanced Security Configuration, turn it off for administrators.

trans-unit.source: You can enable it again after you install IPython.
trans-unit.target: You can enable it again after you install IPython.

trans-unit.source: Download and install the latest 32-bit version of <link><linkText>Python 2.7[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Download and install the latest 32-bit version of <link><linkText>Python 2.7[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add C:\Python27 and C:\Python27\Scripts to your PATH environment variable.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add C:\Python27 and C:\Python27\Scripts to your PATH environment variable.

trans-unit.source: Install <link><linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>PyZMQ[pyzmq]</linkText><title></title></link> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Install <link><linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>PyZMQ[pyzmq]</linkText><title></title></link> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Download and install NumPy[numpy] using the .exe binary installer available on their website.
trans-unit.target: Download and install NumPy[numpy] using the .exe binary installer available on their website.

trans-unit.source: As of this writing, the latest version is numpy-1.9.1-win32-superpack-python2.7.exe.
trans-unit.target: As of this writing, the latest version is numpy-1.9.1-win32-superpack-python2.7.exe.

trans-unit.source: Install <link><linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title></link> with the following command.
trans-unit.target: Install <link><linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title></link> with the following command.

trans-unit.source: Download and install <link><linkText>OpenSSL[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Download and install <link><linkText>OpenSSL[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the required Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable on the same download page.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the required Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable on the same download page.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add C:\OpenSSL-Win32\bin to your PATH environment variable.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add C:\OpenSSL-Win32\bin to your PATH environment variable.

trans-unit.source: When installing OpenSSL, use version 1.0.1g or later as these include a fix for the Heartbleed security vulnerability.
trans-unit.target: When installing OpenSSL, use version 1.0.1g or later as these include a fix for the Heartbleed security vulnerability.

trans-unit.source: Install IPython using the following command.
trans-unit.target: Install IPython using the following command.

trans-unit.source: Open a port in Windows Firewall.
trans-unit.target: Open a port in Windows Firewall.

trans-unit.source: On Windows Server 2012, the firewall will block incoming connections by default.
trans-unit.target: On Windows Server 2012, the firewall will block incoming connections by default.

trans-unit.source: To open port 9999, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To open port 9999, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Start Windows Firewall with Advanced Security from the Start screen.
trans-unit.target: Start Windows Firewall with Advanced Security from the Start screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Inbound Rules in the left panel.
trans-unit.target: Click Inbound Rules in the left panel.

trans-unit.source: Click New Rule in the Actions panel.
trans-unit.target: Click New Rule in the Actions panel.

trans-unit.source: In the New Inbound Rule Wizard, select Port.
trans-unit.target: In the New Inbound Rule Wizard, select Port.

trans-unit.source: In the next screen, select TCP and enter 9999 in Specific local ports.
trans-unit.target: In the next screen, select TCP and enter 9999 in Specific local ports.

trans-unit.source: Accept defaults, give the rule a name and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Accept defaults, give the rule a name and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Configure the IPython Notebook
trans-unit.target: Configure the IPython Notebook

trans-unit.source: Next, we configure the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: Next, we configure the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a custom
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a custom

trans-unit.source: IPython configuration profile to encapsulate the configuration information with the following command.
trans-unit.target: IPython configuration profile to encapsulate the configuration information with the following command.

trans-unit.target: Next we cd to the profile directory to create our SSL certificate and edit

trans-unit.source: the profiles configuration file.
trans-unit.target: the profiles configuration file.

trans-unit.source: On Linux use the following command.
trans-unit.target: On Linux use the following command.

trans-unit.source: On Windows use the following command.
trans-unit.target: On Windows use the following command.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create the SSL certificate(Linux and Windows).
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create the SSL certificate(Linux and Windows).

trans-unit.source: Note that since we are creating a self-signed SSL certificate, when connecting
trans-unit.target: Note that since we are creating a self-signed SSL certificate, when connecting

trans-unit.source: to the notebook your browser will give you a security warning.
trans-unit.target: to the notebook your browser will give you a security warning.

trans-unit.source: For long-term
trans-unit.target: For long-term

trans-unit.source: production use, you will want to use a properly signed certificate associated
trans-unit.target: production use, you will want to use a properly signed certificate associated

trans-unit.source: with your organization.
trans-unit.target: with your organization.

trans-unit.source: Since certificate management is beyond the scope of
trans-unit.target: Since certificate management is beyond the scope of

trans-unit.source: this demo, we will stick to a self-signed certificate for now.
trans-unit.target: this demo, we will stick to a self-signed certificate for now.

trans-unit.source: In addition to using a certificate, you must also provide a password to protect
trans-unit.target: In addition to using a certificate, you must also provide a password to protect

trans-unit.source: your notebook from unauthorized use.
trans-unit.target: your notebook from unauthorized use.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons IPython uses
trans-unit.target: For security reasons IPython uses

trans-unit.source: encrypted passwords in its configuration file, so you'll need to encrypt your
trans-unit.target: encrypted passwords in its configuration file, so you'll need to encrypt your

trans-unit.source: password first.
trans-unit.target: password first.

trans-unit.source: IPython provides a utility to do so; at a command prompt run the following command.
trans-unit.target: IPython provides a utility to do so; at a command prompt run the following command.

trans-unit.source: This will prompt you for a password and confirmation, and will then print the
trans-unit.target: This will prompt you for a password and confirmation, and will then print the

trans-unit.source: password as follows.
trans-unit.target: password as follows.

trans-unit.source: Next, we will edit the profile's configuration file, which is the
trans-unit.target: Next, we will edit the profile's configuration file, which is the

trans-unit.source: ipython_notebook_config.py file in the profile directory you are in.
trans-unit.target: ipython_notebook_config.py file in the profile directory you are in.

trans-unit.source: Note that this file may not exist -- just create it.
trans-unit.target: Note that this file may not exist -- just create it.

trans-unit.target: This

trans-unit.target: You can open

trans-unit.target: this file with any text editor of your liking, and you should ensure that it

trans-unit.target: Run the IPython Notebook

trans-unit.target: At this point we are ready to start the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.target: To do this,

trans-unit.target: navigate to the directory you want to store notebooks in and start

trans-unit.source: A powerful paradigm: live computational documents with rich media
trans-unit.target: A powerful paradigm: live computational documents with rich media

trans-unit.source: The notebook itself should feel very natural to anyone who has used Python and
trans-unit.target: The notebook itself should feel very natural to anyone who has used Python and

trans-unit.source: a word processor, because it is in some ways a mix of both: you can execute
trans-unit.target: a word processor, because it is in some ways a mix of both: you can execute

trans-unit.source: blocks of Python code, but you can also keep notes and other text by changing
trans-unit.target: blocks of Python code, but you can also keep notes and other text by changing

trans-unit.source: the style of a cell from "Code" to "Markdown" using the drop-down menu in the
trans-unit.target: the style of a cell from "Code" to "Markdown" using the drop-down menu in the

trans-unit.source: toolbar.
trans-unit.target: toolbar.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: But this is much more than a word processor, as the IPython notebook allows the
trans-unit.target: But this is much more than a word processor, as the IPython notebook allows the

trans-unit.source: mixing of computation and rich media (text, graphics, video and virtually
trans-unit.target: mixing of computation and rich media (text, graphics, video and virtually

trans-unit.source: anything a modern web browser can display).
trans-unit.target: anything a modern web browser can display).

trans-unit.source: For example, you can mix
trans-unit.target: For example, you can mix

trans-unit.source: explanatory videos with computation for educational purposes.
trans-unit.target: explanatory videos with computation for educational purposes.

trans-unit.target: And with the power of Python's many excellent libraries for scientific and

trans-unit.source: This paradigm of mixing the power of the modern web with live computation
trans-unit.target: This paradigm of mixing the power of the modern web with live computation

trans-unit.source: offers many possibilities, and is ideally suited for the cloud; the Notebook
trans-unit.target: offers many possibilities, and is ideally suited for the cloud; the Notebook

trans-unit.source: can be used:
trans-unit.target: can be used:

trans-unit.source: As a computational scratchpad to record exploratory work on a problem.
trans-unit.target: As a computational scratchpad to record exploratory work on a problem.

trans-unit.source: To share results with colleagues, either in 'live' computational form or in
trans-unit.target: To share results with colleagues, either in 'live' computational form or in

trans-unit.source: hardcopy formats (HTML, PDF).
trans-unit.target: hardcopy formats (HTML, PDF).

trans-unit.source: To distribute and present live teaching materials that involve computation,
trans-unit.target: To distribute and present live teaching materials that involve computation,

trans-unit.source: so students can immediately experiment with the real code, modify it and
trans-unit.target: so students can immediately experiment with the real code, modify it and

trans-unit.source: re-execute it interactively.
trans-unit.target: re-execute it interactively.

trans-unit.source: To provide "executable papers" that present the results of research in a way
trans-unit.target: To provide "executable papers" that present the results of research in a way

trans-unit.source: that can be immediately reproduced, validated and extended by others.
trans-unit.target: that can be immediately reproduced, validated and extended by others.

trans-unit.source: As a platform for collaborative computing: multiple users can log in to the
trans-unit.target: As a platform for collaborative computing: multiple users can log in to the

trans-unit.source: same notebook server to share a live computational session.
trans-unit.target: same notebook server to share a live computational session.

trans-unit.source: If you go to the IPython source code <link><linkText>repository[]</linkText><title></title></link>, you will find an entire
trans-unit.target: If you go to the IPython source code <link><linkText>repository[]</linkText><title></title></link>, you will find an entire

trans-unit.source: directory with notebook examples which you can download and then experiment with on your own Azure IPython VM.
trans-unit.target: directory with notebook examples which you can download and then experiment with on your own Azure IPython VM.

trans-unit.source: Simply download the .ipynb files from the site and upload them onto the dashboard of your notebook Azure VM (or download them directly into the VM).
trans-unit.target: Simply download the .ipynb files from the site and upload them onto the dashboard of your notebook Azure VM (or download them directly into the VM).

trans-unit.source: Conclusion
trans-unit.target: Conclusion

trans-unit.source: The IPython Notebook provides a powerful interface for accessing interactively
trans-unit.target: The IPython Notebook provides a powerful interface for accessing interactively

trans-unit.source: the power of the Python ecosystem on Azure.
trans-unit.target: the power of the Python ecosystem on Azure.

trans-unit.source: It covers a wide range of
trans-unit.target: It covers a wide range of

trans-unit.source: usage cases including simple exploration and learning Python, data analysis and
trans-unit.target: usage cases including simple exploration and learning Python, data analysis and

trans-unit.source: visualization, simulation and parallel computing.
trans-unit.target: visualization, simulation and parallel computing.

trans-unit.source: The resulting Notebook
trans-unit.target: The resulting Notebook
